body.p:
J. H. Price states on oath that since the conviction of Timothy King that he enquired at Exchange barracks & at barracks no One if such a man as Wm Millon had been any time stationed at either of the places. affiant was informed by several non commissioned officers that Wm Millon had been stationed at the both places & at the time that deceased was Killed he was stationed at no one barracks, said barracks beeing about fifty yards from Exchange barracks on the cor of 7th & main, Affiant was also informed that Corporal Hoosier mentioned in the affidavit of Tim King was stationed at Exchange Barracks at the time deceased was Killed. Affiant further states that he acted as counsel for Tim King & when he filed grounds for new trial he had Reynolds Hill ord sergt. in Court who would have proven the facts set forth above, other witnesses were also present who was acquainted
with Wm Millon & Knew that he was at the barracks at the time that deceased was killed, & that he was not sent off for some days after King was arrested.
subscribed & sworn to before me this 16th of October 1865
att Jas P Chambers c J c c
